name: Gulf Cooperation Council
description: The Cooperation Council for the Arab States of the Gulf (Arabic: مجلس التعاون لدول الخليج العربي‎), originally (and still colloquially) known as the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC, مجلس التعاون الخليجي), is a regional intergovernmental political and economic union consisting of all Arab states of the Persian Gulf except Iraq, namely: Bahrain, Kuwait, Oman, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, and the United Arab Emirates.[3] The Charter of the GCC was signed on 25 May 1981, formally establishing the institution.
